intro: Chamaesyce fendleri var. chaetocalyx, commonly known as the hairy leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in the spring and early summer.
